links.title: Why Apple's iMessage Is Winning: Teens Dread the Green Text Bubble
links.description: Soon after 19-year-old Adele Lowitz gave up her Apple iPhone 11 for an experimental go with an Android smartphone, a friend in her long-running texting group chimed in: "Who's green?" The reference to the color of group text messages-Android users turn Apple Inc.'s iMessage into green bubbles instead of blue-highlighted one of the challenges of her experiment.

message.body:
@cleanair I’m not an expert. Nor do I claim to be one, this is just my unprofessional opinion. But based off of objective options data. It looks bearish for the month of Jan. In my opinion. The $180 AAPL calls ARE STILL BEING BOUGHT/SOLD like crack cocaine in the 80s. In simple terms there is exuberant speculation based off of nothing… but there is a healthy amount of puts, so this could just go sideways the entire month. But I will say without any shadow of a doubt that I do not think Apple will see the price of $180 during the month of January. (At least not until the 1/21 monthly options expire) That I can say with very high certainty. And I’m basing this off of looking at the option chain for five minutes. This is not an in-depth analysis…. The only way that Apple crosses over $180 during the month of January is if they announce something unbelievable that would change the world. Other than that. Dead money in the month Jan 🤷‍♂️

do your own DD Everyone.  Not financial advice. 🕺
